justification: The project exhibits a script-based architecture with low module count and shallow directory structure, leading to limited separation of concerns. Decomposability will help reorganize the codebase into well-defined modules or layers, improving maintainability by isolating functionality, simplifying testing, and making the system easier to analyze.
expected_architectural_change: Refactor the textrank/__init__.py file into multiple cohesive modules based on functionality (e.g., graph building, phrase extraction, summarization). Introduce a layered structure separating data handling, processing logic, and CLI interaction. This will increase the directory depth and package structure maturity from script-based to modular monolith.
risks: Initial refactoring may introduce bugs if dependencies are not carefully managed. Team members may require time to adapt to new module boundaries. Risk of over-engineering if decomposition is taken too far for the current scale of the project.
